title: `rerun` doing things in the wrong order or at all?!
body:
@kyleam I am working with the result of the lessen 03-01 ohbm training section, and run in a fresh clone of the final dataset state:

`datalad rerun --branch verify --onto ready4analysis --since ready4analysis`

This fails with:

```
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'annex', 'unlock', '--', '.'] under '/home/vagrant/lesson-03-01/fromarchive'. Exit code=1. out=unlock .datalad/environments/fsl/image 
failed
unlock sub-02/onsets/run-1/body.txt 
failed
...
```

This is weird. The relevant run records are:

```
    {
     "chain": [],
     "cmd": "bash -c 'sed -e \"s,##BASEPATH##,{pwd},g\" -e \"s,##SUB##,sub-02,g\
     "dsid": "21c65cb4-707a-11e8-a801-0800277be888",
     "exit": 0,
     "inputs": [],
     "outputs": [
      "sub-02/1stlvl_design.fsf"
     ],
     "pwd": "."
    }

    {
     "chain": [],
     "cmd": "singularity exec .datalad/environments/fsl/image feat '{inputs[0]}'
     "dsid": "21c65cb4-707a-11e8-a801-0800277be888",
     "exit": 0,
     "inputs": [
      "sub-02/1stlvl_design.fsf",
      "sub-02/onsets",
      "inputs/rawdata/sub-02/func/sub-02_task-oneback_run-01_bold.nii.gz",
      ".datalad/environments/fsl/image"
     ],
     "outputs": [
      "sub-02/1stlvl_glm.feat"
     ],
     "pwd": "."
    }
```

Why would it have to `git annex unlock -- .` (note the dot at the end).

But the path issue aside: it tried to unlock before it obtains the inputs -- which has to fail. If I `datalad get  .` before `rerun` things start working as expected.
